APPENDIX 3 - TABLE OF ORDINANCE 6222 SECTIONS AND AMENDING ORDINANCES
The provisions of Ordinance 6222, originally adopted on May 28, 1953, have been frequently changed and updated. Generally, outdated material has not been repealed; instead, the groups of articles concerning departments of the county have, since 1956, been updated by successive entire amendments. Consequently, provisions in the same subject area (such as health and hospitals) have appeared under different section numbers at different times. It is for this reason that full legislative history notes are not given following the text of each current section of Ord. 6222. Provisions in Chapter 3, Articles 1 — 89, were removed from the code by Ordinance 81-0050; some of these provisions were again added to the code by Ord. 82-0149P. Legislative history for these provisions follows individual sections; earlier material is found in Appendix 3 to this title.
The following Appendix 3 sets forth all ordinance information concerning each individual section number presently or formerly in Ordinance 6222. Ordinances with earliest passage dates are listed before later ordinances, and repealing ordinance numbers have also been supplied for continuity.
For Example:
Section
XX — Enacted by Ord. A, amended by B and C, etc.
Section
YY — In (appeared in) Ord. D, amended by Ords. E — G, last amendment Ord. H, 1959.*
Added by Ord. K, 1965; repealed by Ord. M, 1970.
* An asterisk following an ordinance listing means "neither amended nor specifically repealed, and section number not kept current after this date."

Chapter 3 - Department Articles
Editor's note—
Ordinance 81-0050 removed the Departmental Articles (Chapter 3, Sections 420 — 890, of Ordinance 6222), codified as Chapters 6.30 through 6.128, from the code volume. Section 15 of Ordinance 82-0149P added Division 3, Departmental Provisions, to the code. Code Sections in Division 3 will show legislative history data for amendments following Ordinance 82-0149P. Note that Ordinance 82-0153P, the personnel staffing ordinance (and its successor ordinances) contains staff position information formerly set out in portions of Chapter 3; it is not codified.
Editor's note—
Article numbers are not shown for Ch. 3 material.

900
In 9577 § 23 (part), 1968.*
Notes:
Ord. 6604 § 2, 1955 changes all earlier references to "surveyor" to be "engineer."
Ord. 9805 § 32, 1969 states: "Wherever Ord. 6222 refers to 59 hours, each such reference is amended to read 56 hours."
Ord. 11807 § 2, 1978 states: "Whenever in any ordinance or document reference is made to the Harbor General Hospital or Los Angeles County Harbor General Hospital, such reference shall be deemed to be a reference to the Los Angeles County Harbor-UCLA Medical Center . . ."
